Photograph 12.08: Excavations Qumran; a view to the north from the areas of Trench A and B, located to the north of the site,March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.09: Excavations Qumran; throwing away debris coming from inter alia loci 91 en 93 down the ravine, March 21,1954

Photograph 12.10: Excavations Qumran; throwing away debris coming from inter alia loci 91 en 93 down the ravine, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.11: Excavations Qumran; view from locus 86 to the north. Two students of the École Biblique are laying bare wooden remains in front of a block in locus 86-87, known as the ‘pantry’, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.12: Excavations Qumran; a Bedouin man is posing while he is exposing wooden remains which lie against the eastern wall of locus 86, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.13: Excavations Qumran; baskets filled with fragments of pottery, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.14: Excavations Qumran; this picture is taken from locus 89 to the west. It looks over the top of a basin on the exterior western wall of this locus to where men are excavating pool locus 91 and walking in locus 96 to tip out their baskets into the ravine, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.15: Excavations Qumran; the photograph is taken in locus 94, with the reinforcement wall of locus 90 (the back of locus 89) on the right. The view is looking north over loci 92, 88 and 81, towards the tower, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.16: Excavations Qumran; the photo has been taken from the western edge of the pool of locus 91 in a south-eastern direction, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.17: Excavations Qumran; the Bedouin man is working in loci 54- 55, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.18: Excavations Qumran; the man would appear to be sitting in locus 6- as this number is written on the plaster to the right of his face- located on the north-east side of the settlement. However, the visible remains and also the wall behind do not match this location at all, March 21, 1954

Photograph 12.19: Dead Sea, direction of Jericho, March 22, 1954

Photograph 12.20: Dead Sea, direction of Transjordan, March 22, 1954

Photograph 12.21: Bedouin resting-place, Qumran, March 23, 1954

Photograph 12.22: Pay day, Qumran; Roland de Vaux is sitting in front of a tent paying a local worker. Presumably the recipient is signing for receipt, March 25, 1954

Photograph 12.23: Tea break, Qumran; from right to left: Roland de Vaux; Józef Tadeusz Milik; Ernest-Marie Laperrousaz; a student possibly named L. Sirand; unknown and Leo Boer, March 25, 1954

Photograph 12.24: Measurement of the site, Qumran; Roland de Vaux, accompanied by two students of the École Biblique, is surveying at locus 96. The men are standing next to the cistern (locus 91) that was being excavated that week, March 25, 1954

Photograph 12.25: Measurement of the site, Qumran; Roland de Vaux and a colleague are surveying locus 96, March 25, 1954

Photograph 12.26: Cave 1Q, Qumran; the man with the beret standing outside the lower opening of cave 1Q. An additional entrance had been created below the small top opening, March 26, 1954
